The colony's commitment to sustainable and renewable energy sources is evident in their use of both solar and geothermal power for their mains, as well as the solar panels on individual buildings.

The solar power system consists of large solar arrays strategically placed throughout the colony to harness sunlight efficiently. These solar arrays convert sunlight into electricity, which is then fed into the colony's power grid. In addition, individual buildings are equipped with solar panels to generate additional electricity, reducing the overall demand on the central power grid.

Geothermal power plants tap into the natural heat of the planet, using the heat to generate electricity. These plants are located at geothermal hotspots, where the Earth's crust is thinner and heat can be accessed more easily. The electricity generated by the geothermal plants is then distributed throughout the colony via the power grid.

The combination of solar and geothermal power provides the colony with a reliable and environmentally friendly energy supply, reducing their reliance on fossil fuels and minimizing their carbon footprint. This integrated approach to energy generation is a testament to the colony's dedication to sustainability and responsible stewardship of the environment.
